docs.title: E2S Visualitations (E2SViz)
docs.text:
E2SViz is a data visualization package that allows data preprocessing, e2sviz.data.standard_data_process.DataPrep & e2sviz.data.standard_data_process.DataManip, and data visualisation, e2sviz.visualization.visualize.DataViz.

Examples of how to use e2svizs' functionality can be found in e2sviz_example.ipynb which uses demo data example_consumption_data.csv.

docs.title: ConvertColumnDataFormat dataclass
docs.text:
Converts column wise data to row wise.

Attributes:

Name Type Description freq Optional[str]

Frequency of the data, by default '30T'.

datetime_format Optional[str]

Datetime format of the data, by default '%d/%m/%Y'.

date_column Optional[str]

Column name of the date column, by default 'Settlement Date'.

Methods:

Name Description data_cleaner

Reorder data from column wise to row wise.

convert_half_hourly_to_datetime

Convert half hourly data to datetime.

prep_for_formatting

Prepare data for formatting.

docs.title: convert_half_hourly_to_datetime(datetime_str)
docs.text: Convert half hourly data to datetime.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: datetime_str : str Half hourly data.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: datetime.datetime Datetime object.

docs.title: data_cleaner(data)
docs.text: Reorder data from column wise to row wise.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Raw data in a dataframe.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame DataFrame, with values reordered.

docs.title: prep_for_formatting(data)
docs.text: Prepare data for formatting.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Raw data in a dataframe.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: df_long : pd.DataFrame DataFrame, with values reordered.

docs.title: FillMissingData dataclass
docs.text:
Fills missing values in dataframe.

Attributes:

Name Type Description func str

Method to use for filling missing values.

Methods:

Name Description data_cleaner

Fill missing values in the data.

fillna_mean

Fill missing values with column means.

fillna_rolling

Fill missing values using rolling mean.

docs.title: data_cleaner(data)
docs.text: Fill missing values in the data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Pandas dataframe. func : str 'meanfill' or 'rollingfill'.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame DataFrame, with values filled.

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: ValueError Raised when an unsupported fill method is provided.

docs.title: fillna_mean(data)
docs.text: Fill missing values in the data with column means.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Input data.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame Data with missing values filled with column means.

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: ValueError Raised when an unsupported data type is provided.

docs.title: fillna_rolling(data)
docs.text: Fill missing values in the data using rolling mean.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Input data.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame Data with missing values filled using rolling mean.

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: ValueError Raised when an unsupported data type is provided.

docs.title: GenerateDatetime dataclass
docs.text:
Creates a datetime for dataset or without one.

Attributes:

Name Type Description start_date datetime

When the datetime series will start, by default datetime(2022, 1, 1).

freq str

Frequency of the datetime series, by default "30T".

periods int

Length used to set the length of the array if no data is given, by default 48.

tz str

Timezone for the datetime series, by default 'UTC'.

Methods:

Name Description data_cleaner

Add datetime column to the data.

docs.title: data_cleaner(data)
docs.text: Add datetime column to the data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Either numpy array or pandas dataframe. start_date : Optional[datetime.datetime] When the datetime series will start, by default datetime(2022, 1, 1). freq : Optional[str] Frequency of the datetime series, by default "30T". periods : Optional[int] Length used to set the length of the array if no data is given, by default 48. tz : Optional[str] Timezone for the datetime series, by default 'UTC'.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame Input data with datetime column (index if DataFrame, column zero if array).

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: ValueError Raised when an unsupported data type is provided.

docs.title: OutlierRemover dataclass
docs.text:
Removes outliers from dataframe.

Attributes:

Name Type Description method str

Method to use for outlier removal.

Methods:

Name Description data_cleaner

Remove outliers from the data.

iqr_outliers

Use interquartile range to find outliers.

docs.title: data_cleaner(data)
docs.text: Remove outliers from the data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame Either numpy array or pandas dataframe.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame Dataframe of cleaned data.

docs.title: iqr_outliers(data)
docs.text: Use interquartile range to find outliers.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: values : np.ndarray Input array to find outliers.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray Boolean array indicating outliers.

docs.title: convert_data_types(data, columns=None)
docs.text: Convert data types between NumPy ndarray and pandas DataFrame.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame Input data to be converted. columns : List[str] | None List of column names for DataFrame conversion. Defaults to None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame Converted data in the specified type.

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: ValueError Raised when an unsupported data type is provided.

docs.title: retrieve_data(data)
docs.text: Retrieve the underlying NumPy ndarray from the input data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame Input data from which to retrieve the ndarray.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray NumPy ndarray representing the input data.

docs.title: Raises
docs.text: ValueError Raised when an unsupported data type is provided.

docs.title: add_time_features(dataf)
docs.text: Add time features to the dataframe. The features added are, Hour, Day of week, Day of year, Month, Year, Weekday flag, Half hour, Date, Week, Season & Season number.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The dataframe to add time features to.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The dataframe with the time features added.

docs.title: format_avg_week_index(dataf, timestep)
docs.text: Formats the index of the average week dataframe to be a tidier index.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The dataframe to format the index for. timestep : enums.TimeStep The timestep of the data.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.Index The formatted index.

docs.title: get_avg_week_by_season_df(dataf, target_col, timestep=enums.TimeStep.HALFHOUR, func=np.mean)
docs.text: Takes a timeseries dataframe that has added time_features and returns a dataframe of average weeks for each season. Good for use with data that has a seasonal pattern.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The dataframe to get the average week by season for. target_col : str The column to get the average week by season for. timestep : Optional[enums.TimeStep] The timestep of the data. Default is enums.TimeStep.HALFHOUR. func : Optional[Callable] The function to use to aggregate the data. Default is np.mean.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame A dataframe of average weeks for each season.

docs.title: get_season(month)
docs.text: Returns the season for a given month.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: month : int The month to get the season for.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: str The season for the given month.

docs.title: CombineColumnManipulator
docs.text:
Manipulate data by combining columns.

Methods:

Name Description data_formatter

Format the data by combining columns.

docs.title: data_formatter(data, col_1, col_2)
docs.text: Format the data by combining columns.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame The input data. col_1 : str | int The first column to combine. col_2 : str | int The second column to combine.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame The data with a new column containing the combined values.

docs.title: EquationManipulator
docs.text:
Manipulate data by applying equations.

Methods:

Name Description data_formatter

Format the data by applying equations.

docs.title: data_formatter(data, target_col, func, new_col='New column')
docs.text: Format the data by applying equations.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : np.ndarray pd.DataFrame The input data. target_col : str | int The target column to aggregate. func : str The aggregation function as a string. new_col : str | float The name for the new column, by default 'New column'.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame The data with a new column of aggregated values.

docs.title: GroupbyManipulator
docs.text:
Manipulate data by grouping.

Methods:

Name Description data_formatter

Format the data by grouping.

docs.title: data_formatter(data, groupby, agg, target=None)
docs.text: Format the data by grouping.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame The input data. groupby : list[int | str] The columns to group by. agg : str The aggregation method. target : int | str | None The column to aggregate, by default None.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame The grouped data.

docs.title: ResampleManipulator
docs.text:
Resampler class.

Methods:

Name Description data_formatter

Resample the data.

docs.title: data_formatter(data, split_by, aggregation)

docs.title: Parameters

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: np.ndarray | pd.DataFrame The resampled data.

docs.title: create_seasonal_average_week(season, dataf, target_col=None, func=np.mean)
docs.text: Create a seasonal average week for the specified season.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: season : enums.Season The season for which to calculate the average week. dataf : pd.DataFrame The input DataFrame. target_col : str | None The target column for aggregation. If None, the first column of the DataFrame is used, by default None. func : callable The aggregation function to use, by default np.mean.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The seasonal average week.

docs.title: find_week_in_season(loop_data)
docs.text: Find the week in each season of the year.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: loop_data : pd.DataFrame The input DataFrame.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: list[pd.DataFrame] A list of DataFrames containing the weekly data for each season.

docs.title: get_seasonal_week(data)
docs.text: Get weekly data for each season.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame The input DataFrame.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: list[pd.DataFrame] A list of DataFrames containing the weekly data for each season.

docs.title: seasonal_avg_week_plot_data(plot_data)
docs.text: Prepare data for the seasonal average week plot.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: plot_data : pd.DataFrame The input DataFrame.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: tuple[pd.Index, pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame] A tuple containing the datetime index and the average, maximum, and minimum seasonal average week data.

docs.title: DataManip dataclass
docs.text:
Class for manipulating data.

Attributes:

Name Type Description data DataFrame

The input DataFrame.

frequency FrequencySchema

The frequency of the data, by default viz_schema.FrequencySchema.MISSING.

Methods:

Name Description check_freq

Check the frequency of the data.

check_meta_data

Check for metadata.

val_rescaler

Rescale the values of the column data.

unit_rescaler

Rescale the units of the column data.

check_rescaling

Check if the column data requires rescaling.

filter

Filter the data by given year, month, day or date.

groupby

Group the data by given column/s and aggregate by a given function.

populate_legend

Populate the legend column of the metadata.

update_metadata

Update the metadata for the grouped data.

resampled

Resample the data by given frequency and aggregate by a given function.

rolling

Rolling window function.

inplace_data

Return the DataManip either as its self or as a new variable.

docs.title: column_from_freq: str property
docs.text: Get the column name from the frequency.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: str The column name from the frequency.

docs.title: dict_of_groupbys: dict[str, dict[str, list[str]]] property
docs.text: Get the dictionary of groupby columns.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: dict[str, dict[str, list[str]]] The dictionary of groupby columns.

docs.title: check_freq()
docs.text: Check the frequency of the data if value not provided, it will be infered using pd.infer_freq().

docs.title: check_meta_data()
docs.text: Check for metadata, if not provided, default values will be generated/infered from the data available.

docs.title: check_rescaling()
docs.text: Checks if the column data requires rescaling.

docs.title: filter(year=None, season=None, month=None, day=None, hour=None, date=None, columns=None, inplace=False)
docs.text: Filter the data by given year, month, day or date.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: year : list[int] The years to filter by. season : list[int] The seasons to filter by (1: Winter, 2: Spring, 3: Summer, 4: Autumn). month : list[int] The months to filter by. day : list[int] The days to filter by. date : list[datetime.date] The dates to filter by. inplace : bool Whether to filter the data in place or return a new DataFrame.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The filtered DataFrame. None If inplace is True filtered data is set to self.data.

docs.title: groupby(groupby_type=viz_schema.GroupingKeySchema.WEEK_SEASON, func=np.mean, inplace=False)
docs.text: Group the data by given column/s and aggregate by a given function.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: func : str Numpy function to be used for aggregation. groupby_type : Callable[[pd.DataFrame], pd.Series] The key for dict_of_groupbys used to return groupby columns.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame | pd.Series The grouped and aggregated data.

docs.title: inplace_data(new_data, new_freq=None, new_meta=None, inplace=False)
docs.text: Return the DataManip either as its self or as a new variable.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame The data to be set.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The data.

docs.title: populate_legend(dataf, gb_col_data)
docs.text: Populate the legend column of the metadata.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The grouped and aggregated data. gb_col_data : dict[str, list[str]] The dictionary of groupby columns.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: list[str] The list of legend values.

docs.title: resampled(freq='D', func=np.mean, inplace=False)
docs.text: Resample the data by given frequency and aggregate by a given function.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: freq : str The frequency to be used for resampling. func : Callable[[pd.DataFrame], pd.Series] Numpy function to be used for aggregation.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame | pd.Series The resampled and aggregated data.

docs.title: rolling(window=3, func=np.mean, inplace=False)
docs.text: Rolling window function.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: window : int The window size. func : Callable[[pd.DataFrame], pd.Series] Numpy function to be used for aggregation.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame | pd.Series The rolled and aggregated data.

docs.title: unit_rescaler(column, step)
docs.text: Rescale the units of the column data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: column : str The column to rescale. step : int The step to rescale the column data by.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None

docs.title: update_metadata(grouped_data, gb_col_data)
docs.text: Update the metadata for the grouped data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: grouped_data : pd.DataFrame The grouped and aggregated data. gb_col_data : dict[str, list[str]] The dictionary of groupby columns.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: dict[str, dict[str, str | list[str]]] The updated metadata.

docs.title: val_rescaler(column, multiplier)
docs.text: Rescale the values of the column data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: column : str The column to rescale. multiplier : float The multiplier to rescale the column data by.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None

docs.title: DataPrep dataclass
docs.text:
Performs data preparation steps.

Attributes:

Name Type Description data DataFrame

The input DataFrame.

dataprep_functions list[dataf_callable]

The list of data preparation functions to be applied to the data.

Methods:

Name Description described_data

Returns a DataFrame containing statistics of the input data.

clean_data

Applies the data preparation functions to the data.

docs.title: clean_data()
docs.text: Clean the data by applying specific data preparation steps.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None

docs.title: concat(secondary_data, axis=1, dataprep_functions=None)
docs.text: Concatenate two DataPrep objects.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: secondary_data : DataPrep The secondary DataPrep object to be concatenated to the current one.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: DataPrep The concatenated DataPrep objects.

docs.title: described_data(data)
docs.text: Returns a DataFrame containing statistics of the input data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame The input DataFrame.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame A DataFrame containing the calculated statistics.

docs.title: statistics_of_data(data)
docs.text: Calculate statistics for the input data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.DataFrame The input DataFrame.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame A DataFrame containing the calculated statistics.

docs.title: MetaData dataclass
docs.text:
Class for storing the metadata for the dataframe.

Attributes:

Name Type Description metadata dict[str, dict[str, Any]]

A dictionary of metadata for each column of data.

Methods:

Name Description units

Get the units schema of the column data.

siunits

Get the SI units of the column data.

freq

Get the frequency schema of the column data.

dtype

Get the data type of the column.

column_from_freq

Get the column name from the frequency.

get_x_label

Get the label for the x-axis of the plot.

get_y_label

Get the label for the y-axis of the plot.

get_title

Get the title of the plot.

get_legend

Get the legend of the plot.

docs.text: Get the frequency schema of the column data.

docs.title: Parameters

docs.title: Returns

docs.title: get_x_label: str property
docs.text: Get the label for the x-axis of the plot.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: str The label for the x-axis of the plot.

docs.title: dtype(col)
docs.text: Get the data type of the column.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: col : str The column to get the data type of.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: viz_enums.DataType The data type of the column.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: str The legend of the plot.

docs.title: get_title(col, category=None)
docs.text: Get the title of the plot.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: col : str The column to get the title for.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: str The title of the plot.

docs.title: get_y_label(col)
docs.text: Get the label for the y-axis of the plot.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: col : str The column to get the label for.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: str The label for the y-axis of the plot.

docs.title: siunits(col)
docs.text: Get the SI units of the column data.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: col : str The column to get the SI units of.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: viz_enums.SIUnits The SI units of the column data.

docs.title: units(col)

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: col : str The column to get the units schema of.

docs.title: Returns

docs.title: MatPlotLibPlot dataclass
docs.text:
This class is used to plot the data using matplotlib.

Attributes:

Name Type Description container Optional[Axes]

Matplotlib container holding the Axes for plotting multiple lines on one axis.

plt_kwargs Optional[dict[str, str]]

Dictionary containing the plot settings.

Methods:

Name Description plt_settings

Set the plot settings for matplotlib.

get_column_kwargs

Get the keyword arguments for a column.

set_kwargs

Set the keyword arguments for a plot.

line_plot

Plot a line plot.

stacked_plot

Plot a stacked plot.

corr_plot

Plot a correlation plot.

bar_plot

Plot a bar plot.

dt_bar_plot

Plot a bar plot with datetime on the x-axis.

box_plot

Plot a box plot.

pie_chart

Plot a pie chart.

show

Show the plot.

save

Save the plot.

docs.text: Plot a single line plot

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame Dataframe to plot plot_columns : list[str] Columns to plot dict_kwargs : dict[str, dict[str, str]] Dictionary containing the plot settings x : str, optional x-axis column name, by default None, in which case datetime index is used.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None Updates the figure with the line plot

docs.title: pie_chart(dataf, plot_columns, dict_kwargs)
docs.text: Create a pie chart.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: data : pd.Series Data to plot plot_columns : list[str] Columns to plot dict_kwargs: dict[str, dict[str, str]] Plot settings

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None Updates the figure with the pie chart

docs.title: plotly_settings(fig)
docs.text: Set the plotly figure settings

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: fig : go.Figure Plotly figure

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None The self.container is updated with the figure

docs.title: save(save_path)
docs.text: Saves the plot

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: save_path : Path Path to save the plot

docs.title: set_kwargs(fig, kwargs)
docs.text: Set the keyword arguments for a plot

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: fig : go.Figure Plotly figure kwargs : dict[str, str] Dictionary containing the plot settings

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None Updates the figure with the keyword arguments

docs.title: show()
docs.text: Shows the plot

docs.title: stacked_plot(dataf, plot_columns, dict_kwargs)
docs.text: Plot a stacked line plot

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame Dataframe to plot. plot_columns : list[str] Columns to plot. dict_kwargs : dict[str, dict[str, str]] Dictionary containing the plot settings.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None Updates the figure with the stacked line plot

docs.title: custom_plot(x, y, ax=None, **plt_kwargs)
docs.text: Create a custom plot using matplotlib.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: x : Any x-axis values y : Any y-axis values ax : plt.Axes, optional Matplotlib axes, by default None **plt_kwargs : dict Additional matplotlib plot settings

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: plt.Axes Matplotlib axes

docs.title: custom_plot_from_df(dataf, ax=None, **plt_kwargs)
docs.text: Create a custom plot using matplotlib from a DataFrame.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame Data to plot ax : plt.Axes, optional Matplotlib axes, by default None **plt_kwargs : dict Additional matplotlib plot settings

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: plt.Axes Matplotlib axes

docs.title: DataViz dataclass
docs.text:
Visualises the data.

Attributes:

Name Type Description data DataFrame

The data to be visualised.

metadata MetaData

The metadata of the data.

viz_selector LibraryViz

The visualisation library to be used.

plot_columns list[str]

The columns to be plotted.

x str

The x-axis column.

freq str

The frequency of the data.

Methods:

Name Description plot

Plots the data through the chosen viz_selector.

show_viz

Shows the visualisation.

save_figure

Saves the figure.

structured_data

Returns the data in a structured format.

create_dict_kwargs

Creates the list of kwargs for each column.

_process_grouped_data

Process grouped data and pivot if needed.

format_index

Format the index of the data based on the number of index columns in the metadata.

_adjust_index

Adjust index to be a continuous variable.

remove_index_cols

Remove the index columns from the data after they've been reset.

pivot_data

Pivot the data based on the metadata grouped columns.

docs.title: plot_factory: dict[str, Callable] property
docs.text: Returns the plot factory used for plotting the specific plot type.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: dict[str, Callable] The plot factory used for plotting the specific plot type.

docs.title: create_dict_kwargs()
docs.text: Creates the dict of dicts of kwargs for each column.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: dict[str, dict[str, Any]] The dict of dicts of kwargs for each column.

docs.title: format_index(dataf)
docs.text: Format the index of the data based on the number of index columns in the metadata.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The data to be formatted.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The formatted data.

docs.title: pivot_data(dataf)
docs.text: Pivot the data based on the metadata grouped columns.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The data to be pivoted.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The pivoted data.

docs.title: plot(plot_kind)
docs.text: Plots the data through the chosen viz_selector. Options: line_plot, stacked_plot, corr_plot, bar_plot, dt_bar_plot, box_plot, pie_chart

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: plot_kind : str The kind of plot to be plotted.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None Figure is saved to the container object of the viz_selector.

docs.title: remove_index_cols(dataf)
docs.text: Remove the index columns from the data after they've been reset.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: dataf : pd.DataFrame The data to be processed.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The processed data.

docs.title: save_figure(save_path)
docs.text: Saves the figure.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: save_path : Path The path to save the figure along.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: None The figure is saved to the path.

docs.title: show_viz()
docs.text: Shows the visualisation.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: Any The visualisation currently matplotlib or plotly.

docs.title: structured_data()
docs.text: Returns the data in a structured format.

docs.title: Returns
docs.text: pd.DataFrame The data in a structured format.

docs.title: LibraryViz
docs.text:
Bases: Protocol

Selects the visualisation library to be used (e2sviz.visualization.plot_styles)

docs.title: MetaData
docs.text:
Bases: Protocol

Stores the meta data and returns values for labeling plots (e2sviz.data.standard_data_process).
